title: @Riot, @Meddler, Does Irelia lack a sense of identity?
body:
In both a gameplay and thematic sense, Irelia seems to lack any kind of identity. At best, the most I could muster up is "really, really, really good synergy with Triforce"

Looking at the other two top-lane, melee-carry, bruiser-slayers; {{champion:24}} and {{champion:114}}, it's quite easy to say who they are and what they do. Jax is (stop me if you've heard this before) a dark and mysterious individual with similarly unknown origins, but is known within Runeterra as the guy who can and will beat your ass with anything from a spiked mace to a fishing pole. His gameplay revolves around on-hit, mixed, sustained damage and hyperscaling into a raid boss that will either clean up and ace you ruthlessly, or backdoor all your inhibs and end the game. Fiora stands for honour, discipline, ~~and pretty pictures~~ and draws (at least part of her appeal) from being a no-nonsense matriarch of a noble household with immense pride, and who can best any man in a duel with little effort. Her gameplay revolves around manipulation of vital proccing, outplaying your opponent with good use of Riposte, and being a threat to absolutely everyone with her %health true damage.

And they both have downtime. Fiora and Jax are both (relatively) vulnerable when their Riposte and Counterstrike respectively are down. Due to the nature of their kits being heavily based on auto-attacking, they're also weaker in 2v1's against them.

Irelia is...really, really, really good at abusing Triforce. She also has innate sustain so it's harder than usual to push her out of lane. If you manage to keep her health low and harass her, you're giving her free access to her ~~completely fair and reasonable~~ stun which she _will_ use to win the trade or all-in. If she's caught low, she can just slurp up a tonne of health back by ulting the wave, whereas Jax and Fiora are either forced back or have to play a risky game in order to get their health back.

I imagine a more dedicated Irelia player could come up with something better, and more flattering.

But my point is, Irelia is an incredibly generic AA-based Fighter-type with an overloaded kit that boasts unfair designs. You could call Fiora overloaded too, but her mechanical ceiling extends beyond **aggressively clicking on the enemy and pressing buttons**. I have yet to play a lane where Irelia gets her Triforce and I am still able to even match her, let alone beat her - something that doesnt happen with any other Champion in the game. 

I'd like to say that she should be Old-Poppy'd and put into such a trashheap state that playing her is a detriment to her team until full build, but I won't, because no Champion deserves that.

I will say that I think she really needs changes, or at least needs to be looked at and should absolutely be one of the "big 6 or 4" that Riot tackles in the eventual Diver Update.

replies.body:
Her identity is as a comeback champion, even in her lore she only rose to her power after nearly suffering defeat. With her stun mechanic, reliable healing abilities, and incredible burst potential with sheen she is very capable of winning fights where the enemy champion is at an advantage. 

That being said, she is closer to the feast/famine aspect of the game than some other champions so if she starts to snowball she snowballs hard and you lose that impression of her. Especially in laning though, she is definitely the comeback queen.

This makes no sense.

You're saying a champ that beats you when she's ahead, but also beats you when you're ahead, is balanced?

Firstly, this has nothing to do with balance, and everything to do with identity. For example: Rengar's identity has nothing to do with how successful he is at bursting you, it has everything with how you do it(or fail to do it).

Secondly, you are thinking too broadly, if you put her behind you by killing her, and getting more cs, of course she will most likely lose regardless unless she carefully farms up and deny any more kills. What I mean is, during an engage in an even lane she has the ability to turn losing fights around especially due to her stun, and thanks to her healing. You know, making a comeback.

Irelia shouldn't be changed until certain ranged champions get massive nerfs in the laning phase

Not all ranged champions obviously but the ones that can abuse melees hard like Jayce and Kennen

Irelia's one of the only melee champions who can fight them without dying

Even then I've been having a ton of trouble against ranged champions lately as Irelia.  Idk I just feel like laning against ranged champion as melee this season has been worse than any other season so far, aside from the jayce, kennen, and elise top lane meta (season 2 I think?).  Part of it is probably because creep block is worse than ever before so I guess there's that.

I've also thought of Irelia as the underdog champion who relies on making comebacks against her opponents to win fights.  Her lore and stun reflect that very well.  She's also known as the destroyer of ranged laners which has been her "theme" since her release.  What I find very iconic about her is her Q and E because of the unique mechanics on both of them.  

The conditional stun on her E makes it so both her and her enemy need to make decisions for the most optimal outcome.  If Irelia wants to stun her opponent she needs to keep herself at lower health and risk being CCed and bursted down or she can use the slow instead to help chase down or run away from her opponent.  Likewise her enemies can risk all inning her and being stunned or timing their burst just right and giving her the slow instead of the crucial stun.  The reset mechanic on her Q is probably the most fun thing about her because it gives her the ability to lane against ranged champions as well as dash to minions to catch enemies out.

I feel that what separates her from Jax and Fiora is that while they always want to have the upperhand in a fight she is the mobile fighter that always wants to be at a disadvantage to make the best use of her kit while manipulating her blades to get the job done.  Some people feel like the blades don't really fit into her theme with her kit, but in my opinion I think they do just fine.
-Surfing on her blades to get from place to place
-Activating her hidden power to give her blades energy to deal more damage and heal her
-Using her blades to cripple her enemies
-Flinging her blades at opponents to weaken them while gaining energy from their damage

Her blades don't need to be flying all over the place to fit her theme.  As an avid Irelia player (since season 3) I think her theme is just fine.  Those are just my thoughts.

> Some people feel like the blades don't really fit into her theme with her kit, but in my opinion I think they do just fine.
-Surfing on her blades to get from place to place

-Using her blades to cripple her enemies
-Flinging her blades at opponents to weaken them while gaining energy from their damage

>Her blades don't need to be flying all over the place to fit her theme. As an avid Irelia player (since season 3) I think her theme is just fine. Those are just my thoughts.

Sure, but telekinetically controlled blades have SO MUCH potential that Irelia just wastes.

Imagine how cool her autoattack animation could be, her blades flying around her like Syndra balls and swooping through the enemy, or something.

And, if her blades were flying around her all the time, they could be passively parrying attacks while she was fighting. This could be represented ingame through a variety of mechanics, but currently it's just ignored.

Irelia just uses stuff that would fit on Warwick and be just as thematically fitting, if not more (except the ult).

Morello had stated in the past that she was designed before they had refined some of their "guidelines" to making champs. She was made to try and make melees able to fight ranged etc and was given every mechanic in the game as compensation. Now obviously, everyone can see the flaws in that design. She's a generic auto attacker who isn't fun for players or opponents. She's a walking pile of stats who's favorite item is also a ball of stats. She has no theme. Its hard to even say floating blade user is her theme because very very little in her kit reflects that. 

She needs a Sion level remake. Don't even try to save her current kit. Throw it out and make a new champ out of the telekinetic blade concept because she's wasting a cool design opportunity.
Ironically she would have been a great candidate for Shen's new Spirit Blade mechanics.

Even though you have a point, having one champion that inverts the ranged/melee domination is probably he best we can hope for from Riot. The discrepancy between ranged and melee champs in the laning phase has been the subject of contention for years now, and Riot has shown no initiative to tackle this problem.

It would require such a large scale reworking of so many champions that it would only be a preseason project so as to not completely screw over the pro scene. However, as we've seen so far, Riot is going to have their hands full this coming preseason with trying to make DQ work, the assassin class update, probable keystone tuning, and a few choice champion reworks (Warwick, maybe Galio). With all that on Riot's plate, I can't imagine they'd be able to fix ranged/melee interaction until at least next year's preseason.

And let's be real, Riot probably won't be doing it then either.

Until the day comes when ranged champions get some early game damage nerfs or Doran's Shield is made into an item that melees can actually purchase with confidence to keep them safe, I'm completely fine with Irelia hard countering ranged champs in lane.

Honestly that's why I don't think they should have ever made her. Having a single champion being an answer to a problem of that scale is only going to turn that champion into a problem child.  Just look at Mordekaiser's rework when they wanted him bot! 

I can understand trying to shake the meta, but trying to build champions for a lane that their class usually doesn't belong too or to heavily combat the meta is going to have disastrous effects!  Granted this is a common design idea (Ivern as a support jungler for example) but it usually doesn't go well.   

I think it'll probably be around divers where Riot might try to fix the huge advantage ranged has against melee. Or not because we can't push marksmen out of botlane viability.

>Having a single champion being an answer to a problem of that scale is only going to turn that champion into a problem child. Just look at Mordekaiser's rework when they wanted him bot!

{{champion:150}} is probably a better example. When he's strong, there's a distinct lack of an entire class in the top lane.

>Granted this is a common design idea (Ivern as a support jungler for example) but it usually doesn't go well. 

This is true. For as much crap as I give CertainlyT, his want of a melee champion in bot lane is something I support. However, the execution of this idea so far ({{champion:157}} {{champion:82}}) has been disastrous at best. All it demonstrates is that:

1. In order to compete directly with ranged champions, a melee carry champion will require an overloaded kit just to survive the laning phase.
2. If a champion with an overloaded kit designed for the bot lane isn't specifically forced into the bot lane, they will take their kit to mid or top and unfairly bully opponents there.

Until these two issues are taken care of, melee carries in the bot lane are going to remain a pipe dream unless the entire meta shifts.

>I think it'll probably be around divers where Riot might try to fix the huge advantage ranged has against melee. 

We can only hope. I wouldn't hold your breath though, Riot has been known to completely drop the ball. And then let it sit in the ground for months before maybe stooping to picking it back up. And then throwing the ball out because it was on the ground too long and buying a new ball to replace it.

**To hell with efficiency!** - Riot Games Unofficial Motto
